Text: Is this a workable idea for an articleVince I hope this email finds you well The recent award of the Nobel Prize in Economics to Stiglitz Spence and Akerlof has set me thinking Lots of what Enron does addresses asymmetrical markets by improving information Is it a stretch to apply their theories to energy Do our risk management tools help equalize the amount of information in the marketplace For example Stiglitz says that insurance deductibles is the way that insurance carriers get customers to reveal their potential liability Someone who is more likely to be in poor health or have accidents will seek lower deductibles Do any of Enrons products help us or the energy markets reveal information that creates not only a more effective market but a market that works If there is something substantial to this Id like to write about the subject for Exchange the wholesale customer magazine If it is just an interesting observation thats true perhaps wed run it in eBiz Please take care Jeannie

Bullet pointsmy stab at organizing the tremendous amount of material everyone has gathered these past few days The biggest points are in the biggest bold type The subsidiary points are in smaller bold type The substantial is in regular type Please send me your feedback Jeannie

Revised DeLay op ed Cc great guidance Cynthia hope were in time Jeff the fifth paragraph has some supplydemand figures for the early part of this week that I heard but cant track down the written source Any suggestions Please review and dont hesitate to call me this weekend Best bet is home number or cell phone Jeannie

Cleaned up DeLay Cc helping to locate missing figures in the article Ivew called Joe Alamo for help too Cynthia if youd like I can write around the figures if youre reluctant to submit it with anything unchecked Jeannie

New York lobbying effortI mentioned that my brother an attorney in New York is active in state politics and might be a useful contact in the state Im following up with this note to let you know a bit more about him Larry Mandelker is a partner with Kantor Davidoff Wolfe Mandelker Kass in New York City He is outside counsel to the Republican State Committee and represented Bill Powers when he recently joined the Crane Group in Albany Larry works closely with the Crane Groups legal operation Crane Green Parente in many state matters Theres another reason why I thought to mention Larry He currently represents Sunset Energy Fleet a company managed by Jerry Montrose which is negotiating to win state permits for bargemounted generation off of Brooklyn as well as gas supply contracts He knows exactly what the power industry faces in New York If anyone would like to contact him Ill forward that persons name to him Ill give you his telephone number too x if youd like to file it away Please let me know if theres any additional information youd like to see Take care Jeannie

Re Frevert Piecefor the warning about Windows they want to get me back to Houston to switch me too and Im sure its terrible for remote workers Everything always is Thanks for helping out with this piece I know we have to update to reflect SDGEs new bilateral trade ability Take care Jeannie
Marks column Cc Dasovich made some excellent changes to drive home our message points Thanks Jeff Mark should be pleased with this one Jeannie

Update on Calif PX price cap Cc Parquet read a story we have for ENAs customer magazine Exchange about California Power problems He says we may have the price cap wrong for the PX We have for the PX and for CalISO Are those figures accurate He says the PX applied to FERC for a cap Please advise ASAP as this publication has gone to press and Im not even sure we can change it Thanks Jeannie

an op ed piece on CalISO soft price cap Ive drafted an op ed piece that could go this week while the papers are discussing CalISOFERCs latest move in California I havent discussed this with Jim but either Karen or I could suggest it if the piece is strong Karen I went with the interpretation that Enron doesnt want to see retail price freezes lifted because that would discourage utilities from buying longterm power or structured products from us Jeff as always I could use your help in making sure Ive made the right interpretations and that Ive included all the important points Karen one more thing I think we could take the first paragraphs of this piece and add a third graf quickly explaining Enrons position soft caps are a good first step but we gotta eliminate them entirely and run this as an eBiz if youd like Please let me know your thoughts

Re an op ed piece on CalISO soft price capwants all my material in by end of the day Friday so Friday morning is fine Any FERC action will have to be incorporated into it anyway and we probably wont know the final decision until late Friday It could be worse You could be working for Al Gore Best Jeannie From Jeff NRON on PM Sent by Jeff NRON To Jeannie CT cc Subject Re an op ed piece on CalISO soft price cap Hi Got your message As you know its complete meltdown here so I apologize for not having got back to you sooner Ill read and get back to you Deadline
